ygData.subject: Re: sail the high seas or Swamping at Guk
ygData.msgSnippet: The 2pp forget about it lah. It s nothing really. And if u want to go, I can bring my 15th paladin along, since he can summon hammer and cast buff to make up
ygData.messageBody:
The 2pp forget about it lah. It's nothing really. And if u want to go, I
can bring my 15th paladin along, since he can summon hammer and cast buff to
make up for the lack of armor plsu have infra vision. but I working this
Sat. so will be in late.
----- Original Message -----
From: Alex <leealex@...>
To: <sg-everquest@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, June 03, 1999 13:22
Subject: Re: [sg-everquest] sail the high seas or Swamping at Guk


> From: "Alex" <leealex@...>
>
> Last weekend, saturday. Leshrec, Trifrost and I was suposed to go to
> Faydwek. I was looking forward to it. too bad the ship didnt come. it was
> "under repair"
>
> Im still keen to venture out there.
>
> Another option came up last nite while i was with Leshrec and Eldor ( we
> were at the Oasis of Marr killin Crocs and Caiman)
> Eldor is a Rogue and is a close buddy of Trifrost. We starting talking
about
> going to Upper Guk to hunt Frogglock for Netted, Woven and Mesh stuff. He
> needs to go there sooner or later for 2 rogue quest items.
> Well, Gary aka Garren knows that I have been to Guk(innoluthe Swamp) when
i
> was just a lvl 6. Needless to say, It was a messy death being hit by a
bunch
> of 5 Kobolds and its lead monster JoJo. I lost my Netted golves there too.
> The one that Gary so kindly bought for me for 2PP. That was alot of money
> for a lvl 4 player that time. Thx again Gary :) (psst..i still owe u
2pp,
> not?)
>
> Ok. Im very interested to go adventuring this weekend (sat). Either to the
> Eastern Continent or Upper Guk. Anyone of U guys intersted?. Upper Guk
> should have something for u there. if not than u shouldnt waste time
making
> the trip.
> Faydwek is interesting for a monk like me, cos i dont think there r many
> monks there. I can tank well and hit well now. With double attack and dual
> wielding , i think its ok.
>
> Let me know if any of u guys r keen on any of this expedition.
>
> BTW, goin to upper Guk.... We will have to go NAKED. ya, i mean .Nothing
on.
> Zip. Zero.( well, food and drinks r basic items) . Its like a one-way
trip.
> If no Wiz or Shaman is with us and we r not bind or SOW. If / when we
died
> there, we leave our corpse behind. Save all our goodies in the bank b4 we
> go.
> Hit Frogglocks, get woven and mesh and get out. I should think that Guk
is
> a whole day trip of 6 hrs(real Time), including hunting. Getting there is
> pretty fast. about 15 mins(real time).
>
> Any suggestions?
>
>
> Yiyang of Innoruuk
> Mon'keying to long in and around FP.
>
>
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Leshrec <leshrec@...>
> To: <sg-everquest@onelist.com>
> Date: Wednesday, June 02, 1999 8:39 AM
> Subject: Re: [sg-everquest] sail the high seas
>
>
> >From: "Leshrec" <leshrec@...>
> >
> >Freeport is in my opinion the best place to run xp for levels 1-10.
> Firstly,
> >its the human city, so being the most frequently used race(Look at the
> >amount of classes they can play), the hunting grounds is the most varied.
> >East commons have stuff for level 1-10 and being such a linear area, you
> can
> >run away from stuff quite easily and zone out. As for befallen, try not
to
> >go there at lower levels. Even if you are cautious, someone might train
up
> >ghouls and such and they can root ya. Being level 6, their 30dam hit
would
> >be very fatal indeed ) As for loot, commonlands are also one of the best
> >place for loot ) Fighting lioness and lions, you can get the occasional
> high
> >quality cat pelt or the ruined lion pet which can fetch for a few gold
> >pieces. The asps and darkweed snakes have giant snake fangs which go for
up
> >to 1pp to human players and younger kodiacs sometime gives grizzly pelt
> >which sells for 4-5 gp to NPCs. Once you get about level 11-12, you can
> hunt
> >wisps. They give lightstones and greater lightstones which go for 1pp and
> >5pp respectively to other players and a bit less for NPC. Well if you
need
> >any other information, feel free to send me a tell.
> >
> >Leshrec
> >
> >-----Original Message-----
> >From: Entreri <drizzt@...>
> >To: sg-everquest@onelist.com <sg-everquest@onelist.com>
> >Date: Wednesday, June 02, 1999 8:06 AM
> >Subject: Re: [sg-everquest] sail the high seas
> >
> >
> >>From: "Entreri" <drizzt@...>
> >>
> >>If u come to freeport,u would have a few options[stating the places Ive
> >been
> >>to]
> >>
> >>
> >>East and West commons has quite alot of high xp animals,orcs,scarabs
> >>
> >>If u wanna be more daring,u can try Befallen in West Commons Desert
where
> >>dread lords,Greater Skeles spawn
> >>
> >>
